note: New gen hybrid. Legendary aftermarket. Best resale.
Same platform as TRD Pro, more comfort-oriented, cheaper.
Sweet spot 4Runner. Crawl control & multi-terrain without TRD Pro price.
Base 4Runner. Still hybrid, still capable. Huge value.
Factory overlanding trim. ARB bumper, snorkel-ready, Old Man Emu suspension.
Proven platform. KDSS or TRD Pro suspension. V6 is bulletproof. Huge aftermarket.
Sweet spot 5th gen. Rear locker, crawl control. Easy to find under $35k.
Budget overland. Part-time 4WD, no rear locker, but dirt cheap and reliable.
Luxury 4Runner. E-locker, crawl control. Best interior of the Toyotas.
Less off-road gear than Overtrail but even more luxurious.
Luxury Prado. V8, full-time 4WD, Torsen center diff. Rock-solid reliability.
Budget overlander legend. V8, body-on-frame. Old but simple and reliable.
Heritage nameplate reborn. Shares platform with GX. Hybrid.
Legendary full-size. V8, full-time 4WD, KDSS. Holds value like gold.
Peak Land Cruiser for many. Solid front axle (early) or IFS. Simpler electronics.
Cult classic. Solid axles front/rear, triple-lockable. Prices rising fast.
Luxury Land Cruiser 200. Same drivetrain, nicer interior. Better value than LC200.
Full-size Toyota hybrid. Massive cargo with 3rd row folded.
Same big body, more comfort trim, less trail gear.
Affordable full-size Toyota. V8, massive cargo. Not trail-focused but capable.
Ultimate Toyota luxury. V8 twin-turbo, incredible build quality.
Retro icon. Short wheelbase, rear locker, A-TRAC. Cult following, rising prices.
Best off-road tech. Air suspension, wade sensing. Reliability is the catch.
Same bones as V8, less power but more affordable. Still has air suspension.
8-seat Defender. More cargo, slightly less agile off-road.
The original. Solid axles, simple mechanicals. Agricultural but legendary.
Capable and affordable. Air suspension, Terrain Response. Known issues but fixable.
Modern Discovery. Lost some character but gained refinement. Still very capable.
Sporty luxury. Air suspension, good capability but road-focused.
Ultimate luxury SUV. V8 twin-turbo, waftability supreme.
PHEV with 25-mi EV range. Summit trim is genuinely luxurious.
Same PHEV, less luxury trim, better value.
Off-road focused GC. Skid plates, Selec-Speed Control, extra clearance.
Best value Grand Cherokee. Air suspension on Overland+. Hemi V8 available.
Off-road WK2. Quadra-Lift air suspension, electronic limited-slip.
Massive. 67 cu ft cargo. American luxury. No gear Tetris.
Full-blown luxury. McIntosh audio, quilted leather, massive space.
Icon. Dana 44 axles, lockers, disconnecting sway bar. 4xe adds torque.
Current gen non-hybrid. 3.6 V6 or 2.0T. Dana 44s, lockers, sway bar disconnect.
Proven workhorse. Huge aftermarket. 3.6 V6 (2012+) or 3.8 V6 (earlier).
Last of the simple Wranglers. 4.0 I6 is bulletproof. Coil spring suspension.
Sasquatch pkg: 35" tires, lockers, Dana axles. Best bang/buck off-road.
More street-friendly Bronco. Still capable, nicer interior.
Desert runner. 418 hp twin-turbo, FOX Live Valve shocks, 37" tires.
Same modern Bronco, slightly cheaper used. Early production had some issues.
Off-road Expedition. Big cargo, high clearance, trail turn assist.
Aluminum body, lost weight over 3rd gen. Independent rear suspension.
Largest SUV ever made. 7.3 diesel is legendary. Cabin fits everything.
Classic full-size SUV. Huge cargo. Magnetic ride control.
Current body style. Independent rear suspension, way more cargo than previous.
Solid live axle rear. Less cargo but proven platform. Good value.
Premium Tahoe with off-road gear. Air suspension available.
682 hp supercharged V8. Ultimate American luxury performance.
Highway comfort king. Air suspension handles moderate trails.
Diesel PHEV. Extraordinary range. Less off-road but max efficiency.
S-Class of SUVs. E-Active Body Control, incredible luxury.
Icon. Three locking diffs, solid axles. Small cargo but ultimate capability.
577 hp hand-built V8. Performance G-Wagon. Statement vehicle.
Classic G-Wagen. Solid axles, 3 lockers. Pre-facelift models more affordable.
30+ mi EV range. Best highway manners. Moderate trails only.
Massive BMW luxury. 3rd row, huge presence, highway queen.
738 hp PHEV performance SUV. Controversial styling, extreme capability.
Sports car handling in SUV form. Surprisingly capable off-road with air suspension.
470 hp PHEV. 25+ mi EV range. Best driving dynamics in class.
729 hp. Fastest SUV around a track. PHEV efficiency when you want it.
Sportier roofline, less cargo. Style over practicality.
Coupe-style luxury SUV. Quattro AWD, air suspension available.
500 hp V8. Performance-focused Q8 with sport exhaust.
591 hp. Fastest SUV around Nurburgring. Ridiculous performance.
Best EV for off-road. Quad motors, 14.9" clearance, air suspension. 260+ mi range.
Range-focused R1S. 400+ mi range. Dual motor but still very capable.
Extreme capability. CrabWalk, Extract Mode, 16" clearance. Heavy but unstoppable.
Polarizing but capable. Huge bed, 11K tow. Trail mode via OTA. 300+ mi range.
Tri-motor Cybertruck. 845 hp, faster but shorter range. Same massive utility.
Falcon wing doors, huge glass roof. Road-focused but EV torque helps.
Luxury EV SUV. 300+ mi range. Incredible interior. Light trails only.
Ultimate luxury EV. Hyperscreen, 300+ mi range. Pavement-focused.
Electric G-Wagen. Tank turn capability, quad motors. Ultimate off-road EV.
Budget PHEV with S-AWC. Surprisingly capable. Low towing.
Budget overlander. Body-on-frame, solid rear axle. Extremely affordable.
Underrated full-size. Super Select 4WD, locking center diff. Great value.
Scandinavian luxury PHEV. Best safety tech, beautiful interior.
New flagship EV. 300+ mi range, stunning design, Lidar standard.
Korean luxury bargain. Excellent value, great warranty, refined ride.
Budget trail rig. Body-on-frame, 4.0 V6. Off-road capable and cheap.
Last body-on-frame Pathfinder. V6 or V8. Cheap and capable.
Global overlanding legend. Solid axles, extremely tough. Import only in US.
Ultimate road trip vehicle. Massive cargo, solid towing, surprisingly capable.
Thirsty but capable. Huge presence, solid axles. Cheap now.
Forgotten gem. TOD system, solid rear axle. Incredibly cheap.
Street-focused 4Runner. Sport-tuned suspension, same hybrid drivetrain.
American ultra-luxury. Revel audio, 30-way seats, massive presence.
Gorgeous American luxury. Air glide suspension, Revel audio system.
Redesigned flagship. HBMC suspension, twin-turbo V6, more refined.
Performance luxury SUV. SH-AWD torque vectoring, sport-tuned. Great value.
Best-value three-row. X-Pro adds off-road capability. Nappa leather available.
Telluride sibling. Excellent value luxury, great warranty.
Off-road Honda. TrailWatch cameras, steel skid plates, HPD tuned suspension.
Two-row adventure SUV. Similar TrailSport gear as Pilot, more cargo.
Upmarket Mazda. Premium feel, PHEV efficiency, excellent handling.
Redesigned with boxy look. XRT adds off-road styling, huge cargo.
Lifted Outback. X-Mode dual-function, all-terrain tires. Best Subaru for trails.
Compact trail-rated Subaru. X-Mode, all-terrain tires, lifted.
Top-trim PHEV. 30+ mi EV range, Nappa leather, great value.
Wrangler truck. Dana 44s, front/rear lockers, sway bar disconnect. Unique.
Street-focused Wrangler. More comfort, still capable. No lockers standard.
New gen hybrid truck. i-Force MAX, rear locker, Multi-Terrain Select.
New Lexus three-row PHEV. 37-mi EV range, luxurious cabin.
Sport luxury compact. HTRAC AWD, stunning value vs German competitors.
American icon. 38-inch OLED display, Super Cruise, magnetic ride.
Short wheelbase icon. Same capability as 110, more agile. Air suspension.
Three-row Grand Cherokee. Quadra-Lift air suspension, family hauler.
Launch edition with JBL audio, HUD, rock rails. 2024 only.
Luxury full-size with V8. All-Mode 4WD with low range. Great value used.
